mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Glad he received amount of claim on government; may not be so fortunate in claim against Clarkson; government does not pay private debts of its servants; only exception is ambassadors who are protected against suit; however, government often withdraws protection and allows them to be sued; returns subscription paper of work he proposes.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1812 August 3, Monticello, [Albemarle County, Virginia] to [Count Joseph] Saint Leger Chevalier d'Happart, n.p.
